messages.title: LABOUR’S TAX ON JOBS WILL KILL THE RECOVERY
messages.content: The re-election of Gordon Brown’s government - with more debt, waste and taxes - will bring a new recession. In the last 13 years working people have seen their taxes go up and up and their money wasted. Labour politicians are even talking about new taxes on jobs. Anyone earning between £7,100 and £45,000 will gain up to £150 a year with the Conservatives' tax reduction plans. Labour’s new taxes on jobs would see the public and thousands of jobs across the export, retail and baking sectors at risk.

messages.title: BACKING THE NHS
messages.content: The NHS is our number one priority. We back it and we want to improve it for everyone. The Conservatives will increase spending on the NHS every year. The NHS needs these increases because the pressures it is facing as people live longer and need medical treatments have to be met. We are the party that can provide all the treatments and the new medicines you need. At the same time, we will truly protect the freedoms from targets and bureaucracy and we will invest more on research on cancer survival rates.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Conservatives plan to reduce taxes and stop Labour’s proposed new taxes on jobs to avoid risking thousands of jobs across various sectors.
The Conservatives prioritize the NHS, intending to increase its funding every year, while focusing on reducing targets and bureaucracy, and investing in cancer research.

mentions.candidate: Mark Pritchard working hard for The Wrekin

issues.economy: Labour’s tax on jobs will kill the recovery
issues.health: Conservatives will back the NHS with increased spending and investment in cancer research.

housing.content: Mark Pritchard will reform the welfare system, getting people into jobs and to work. We’re all in this together, and we need new energy and fresh ideas to get Britain working for everyone.

quotes.text: Mark will continue to support public and private sector workers. He has spoken out for their jobs and pensions.

images.caption: Mark Pritchard in various settings, amongst which are with military personnel, signing a document, with police officers, and presenting a petition outside 10 Downing Street.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet promotes Mark Pritchard's commitment to supporting the NHS, economic recovery, and reforming the welfare system to get people back to work.
